author: Special Correspondent
text:
The Opposition on Wednesday claimed that the Governor’s address to the Tamil Nadu Assembly provided nothing new to the State.

In a statement, Leader of the Opposition and DMDK president, Vijayakant, who did not attend the session, said his reactions to the Governor’s address over the three years would fit the present one as well.

“The address did not provide any solution to the mounting debts of the State, which has now crossed Rs 4.5 lakh crore,” he said.

Also, the address claiming that the government made rescue efforts on a war-footing during the floods and that relief has been provided efficiently to the affected people was not true.

PMK founder S. Ramadoss said the entire address was “dedicated to praise Chief Minister Jayalalithaa and the government”.

Pointing to unsolved issues such as agriculture distress, formation of the Cauvery Management Board, reclamation of Katchatheevu and attacks by Sri Lankan navy on Tamil Nadu fishermen, he said the State was in the same situation as it was five years ago and there has been no progress.

'Vision 2023'

MDMK general secretary Vaiko said while the Governor called the ‘Vision 2023’ document an achievement of the government, not much has been done to follow up on the document as the State does not have enough funds.

It did not provide any solution to the mounting debts of the State, says Vijayakant
title: Opposition slams Governor’s address
